docs.snippet: ALBANY, July 26. -- An appeal was made today to the Federal Government by Governor Lehman for a continuance of the use of CCC workers in the State's flooded area. In a telegram to Robert Fechner, director of the emergency conservation work, the Go...

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.lead_paragraph: ALBANY, July 26. -- An appeal was made today to the Federal Government by Governor Lehman for a continuance of the use of CCC workers in the State's flooded area. In a telegram to Robert Fechner, director of the emergency conservation work, the Governor declared continued employment of the workers under the Soil Erosion Service is imperative.

docs.snippet: All too often when disaster strikes, the relief mission seems to last only as long as the media attention....
docs.abstract: Foreign aid missions in response to South Asia tsunami will hopefully last longer than aid missions at previous disasters around world, which lasted only as long as media attention; typically in past, as soon as public focus shifts, governments stop sending money, pledges are withdrawn, many private relief organizations pack their bags and poor are left to finish reconstruction projects in face of same entrenched systems of corruption and neglect; detailed description of foreign aid missions to Honduras after Hurricane Mitch six years ago, to Iran after earthquake in Bam year ago and to Mozambique after floods of 2000 given; photos (L)

byline.original: By GINGER THOMPSON and NAZILA FATHI; Ginger Thompson reported from Honduras for this article and Nazila Fathi from Iran. Stephanie Strom contributed reporting from New York

docs.lead_paragraph: The people of San Miguel Arcángel know all too well what it is like to be struck by disaster, and they have watched the world rush to Asia's rescue with sober eyes. Elder Nahum Cáceres said his entire community was swept off a hillside six years ago by Hurricane Mitch. In his wallet he keeps a handwritten list of the dozen international aid organizations that have come and gone since then.

headline.main: For Honduras and Iran, World's Aid Evaporated
